name: Greek Salad With Goat Cheese
description: This recipe, brought to The Times in a 1991 article about the increasing popularity of goat cheese, is simple and full of bright flavors and satisfying textures. Feta, the cheese traditionally used in this classic salad, would be perfectly appropriate (and delicious), but we recommend giving goat cheese a try. The silken texture of the goat cheese contrasts beautifully with the lively crunch of the vegetables.
keywords: cherry tomatoes, goat cheese, romaine, raw
recipeIngredient: 4 cups romaine lettuce, rinsed, dried and torn into small pieces
1 small red onion, sliced paper-thin and separated into rings
1 small green pepper, cored, seeded and sliced into thin strips
1 pint ripe cherry tomatoes, hulled and halved
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
6 ounces dried textured plain goat cheese, crumbled
8 Greek or Italian black olives in oil, drained

recipeInstructions.text: Sprinkle a little kosher salt into a large glass or ceramic salad bowl. Rub the cut side of the garlic over the salt. Discard the garlic.
Place the lettuce, radishes, onion, scallions, green pepper and tomatoes in the bowl. Add the oregano, mint and dill.
Shortly before serving add the olive oil, toss, then add the vinegar. Season the salad to taste with salt and pepper.
Crumble the goat cheese over the salad, then arrange the olives and anchovy fillets on top. Toss again at the table before serving.
